com.xhive.query.interfaces
Interface XhiveXQueryValueIf

public interface XhiveXQueryValueIf

Represents an XQuery unit value.

The XhiveXQueryValueIf interface represents an XQuery unit value. An XQuery query executed by XhiveNodeIf.executeXQuery(java.lang.String) returns a sequence of these values.

This interface has various methods to retrieve the value it represents as a Java value. To retrieve the value, it is first cast to the corresponding XML Schema type, as if the query had used a cast expression. This also means that if the cast fails, the method will throw an XhiveException.XQUERY_ERROR_VALUE, just as a failed cast expression in the XQuery query.

(c) X-Hive Corporation B.V. (www.x-hive.com)

See Also:
The XQuery specification

Method Detail

getNodeType

short getNodeType()
Get the type of this value. It will return either a node type like Node.ELEMENT_NODE or a simple value type like INTEGER. If the type is a DOM node, use asNode() to retrieve the node.

Returns:
The type of this value.

isNode

boolean isNode()
Determine whether this value is a node.

Returns:
true if this value is a node, false if it is a simple value.

asNode

XhiveNodeIf asNode()
If this value is a Node, return that node, otherwise throws XhiveException.XQUERY_ERROR_VALUE.
